HDG.LOG.content: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)

HDG.LOG.content: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)

HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: Being as its own opposite: a discord (Zwiespalt) w/in Being itself > but this discordant character, as essential to Being, is held together in unity of an essence: das Sein gerade nicht zerspalten sein im Sinne einer Zerstörung seines Wesens [Being cannot be split in sense of destruction of its essence]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being as its own opposite: a discord (Zwiespalt) w/in Being itself > but this discordant character, as essential to Being, is held together in unity of an essence: das Sein gerade nicht zerspalten sein im Sinne einer Zerstörung seines Wesens [Being cannot be split in sense of destruction of its essence]

HDG.BC.content: to be equivalent (Gleiche) something other/additional (mehreres) is needed [Marx & commodity] > to be the same (Selbe), only uniqueness is needed > as the same & unique, Being is forever different from/in itself (but different not in the sense of twice over, repeatedly (mehrmal), or able to be split into multiplicity), incomparable distinction
HDG.BC.linkedContent: to be equivalent (Gleiche) something other/additional (mehreres) is needed [Marx & commodity] > to be the same (Selbe), only uniqueness is needed > as the same & unique, Being is forever different from/in itself (but different not in the sense of twice over, repeatedly (mehrmal), or able to be split into multiplicity), incomparable distinction

HDG.QB.content: acc. Heidegger, in the sense of the will to power, “work” identical to being [?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, in the sense of the will to power, “work” identical to being [?]

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings
HDG.QB.linkedContent: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings

HDG.FS.content: kosmos is fire (pyr): (threefold sense) rising flame (aufsteigende Flamme), brooding glow (brütende Glut), radiating light (strahlendes Licht) > for Heraclitus (unlike modern man who reduces word to one meaning), this manifold richness is kosmos, never isolated, shimmers ungraspably through everything
HDG.FS.linkedContent: kosmos is fire (pyr): (threefold sense) rising flame (aufsteigende Flamme), brooding glow (brütende Glut), radiating light (strahlendes Licht) > for Heraclitus (unlike modern man who reduces word to one meaning), this manifold richness is kosmos, never isolated, shimmers ungraspably through everything

HDG.FS.content: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

HDG.FS.content: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: when power of conjoining disappears, unity itself is experienced [?]: must speak of unity before (vor) dichotomy > pre-philosophical approach, phenomenological in more authentic sense
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when power of conjoining disappears, unity itself is experienced [?]: must speak of unity before (vor) dichotomy > pre-philosophical approach, phenomenological in more authentic sense

HDG.FS.content: experience of rift (Riss) only possible in certain “return to” unity
HDG.FS.linkedContent: experience of rift (Riss) only possible in certain “return to” unity

HDG.FS.content: in a sense, question of Being is entirely other (ganz andere) then that of metaphysics, which asks how being determines being as beings > question of Being inquires into Being as Being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in a sense, question of Being is entirely other (ganz andere) then that of metaphysics, which asks how being determines being as beings > question of Being inquires into Being as Being

HDG.FS.content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element
HDG.FS.linkedContent: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.content: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics
HDG.FS.linkedContent: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics

HDG.FS.content: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production

HDG.FS.content: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)

HDG.FS.content: “the being” for Plato understood in verbal sense (das Seiend) rather than nominal (das Seiende) > determinations of phainesthai and alēthes fully presented in eidos > nothing less Greek than Schopenhauer’s take on Plato (desert exists thanks to my thinking)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “the being” for Plato understood in verbal sense (das Seiend) rather than nominal (das Seiende) > determinations of phainesthai and alēthes fully presented in eidos > nothing less Greek than Schopenhauer’s take on Plato (desert exists thanks to my thinking)

HDG.FS.content: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

HDG.FS.content: Being not forgotten in sense of falling away, nothing negative in forgetting of Being [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Being not forgotten in sense of falling away, nothing negative in forgetting of Being [?]

HDG.FS.content: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself

HDG.FS.content: Kantian contribution to Cartesian theme: anything certain arises from mediation of self-certainty, all knowledge of objectivity is beforehand a knowledge-about-oneself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian contribution to Cartesian theme: anything certain arises from mediation of self-certainty, all knowledge of objectivity is beforehand a knowledge-about-oneself

HDG.FS.content: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.FS.content: Husserlian idea of “surplus (Überschusses)”: the “is” through which I observe object/substance is a “surplus” re: sensuous affections > categorial just as given as sensuous, thus CATEGORIAL INTUITION > Husserl teaches CI by way of analogy (a measure for correspondence): categorial corresponds to sense data (which is the measure of the analogy)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserlian idea of “surplus (Überschusses)”: the “is” through which I observe object/substance is a “surplus” re: sensuous affections > categorial just as given as sensuous, thus CATEGORIAL INTUITION > Husserl teaches CI by way of analogy (a measure for correspondence): categorial corresponds to sense data (which is the measure of the analogy)

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

HDG.FS.content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

HDG.CCP.content: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet

HDG.DL.content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

HDG.LP.content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static
HDG.LP.linkedContent: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind

HDG.WL.content: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

HDG.EC.content: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps
HDG.EC.linkedContent: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps

HDG.EC.content: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present
HDG.EC.linkedContent: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present

HDG.EC.content: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)

HDG.OHF.content: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)

HDG.OHF.content: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked

HDG.OHF.content: system as a context of classification (sketch out framework then allocate respective places for concrete beings) > the relational becomes the object proper, pushes to the fore: dominating/pervading everything, it constitutes being in authentic sense > the classificatory is immutable (Unwandelbare), elevated above what it organizes/rules, the trans-temporal in-itself (das überzeitliche Ansich) (being, validity [Gelten], value, subsistence [Bestehen]—contrasts sensible reality)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: system as a context of classification (sketch out framework then allocate respective places for concrete beings) > the relational becomes the object proper, pushes to the fore: dominating/pervading everything, it constitutes being in authentic sense > the classificatory is immutable (Unwandelbare), elevated above what it organizes/rules, the trans-temporal in-itself (das überzeitliche Ansich) (being, validity [Gelten], value, subsistence [Bestehen]—contrasts sensible reality)

HDG.OHF.content: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present

HDG.OHF.content: [history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant

HDG.OHF.content: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense

HDG.OHF.content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]

HDG.OHF.content: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)

HDG.OHF.content: das Daseiende begegnet im Wie des Besorgtseins, d. h. im Da, das in ein Besorgen gestellt ist [hermeneutic circle?] > the being-there encountered has its own temporality, as cared for in a wider sense [?] > we are concerned for what is not yet, what is approaching: kairological moments of being-there [ek-stasis]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: das Daseiende begegnet im Wie des Besorgtseins, d. h. im Da, das in ein Besorgen gestellt ist [hermeneutic circle?] > the being-there encountered has its own temporality, as cared for in a wider sense [?] > we are concerned for what is not yet, what is approaching: kairological moments of being-there [ek-stasis]

HDG.OHF.content: to understand phenomenal context of significance: must see that its disclosedness stands in respective kind of care that tarries for awhile at a particular time (die Erschlossenheit in der jeweiligen Sorge steht): der Verweisungszusammenhang selbst ist das Besorgte > context of references is the environs in the authentic sense (eigentlich Umhafte), caring as a going around (Umgehen), going-here-and-there [cf. TEXT in Derrida] > significance (ontologically defined): the with-which of dealings (Umgang) with which our being cares
